number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												I played Tomb Raider for 5 hours.  Then uninstalled it, because I accidentally wasn’t playing Tomb Raider.  Every Tomb Raider review is a lie.  You need to buy DLC to put tombs in the game.  And also they’re one room big.  Also, instead of a game that’s designed to allow players to progress naturally through the environment, you get a “SURVIVAL INSTINCT” button, aka, go here button.  If you want free flowing game play or, you know… choice, you won’t find it because instead they hold your hand through hundreds of exciting quick time events!  What are those?  They’re cut scenes that you have to keep watching until you hit the buttons right.  Lara sees an enemy?  QUICK TIME EVENT!  Lara opens a box?  QUICK TIME EVENT!  Lara sneezes?  QUICK TIME EVENT!  It’s funny because you think I’m joking.  While trying to make the game cinematic they forgot to make it fun.  Which might be okay if the story didn’t suck.  I started skipping all of the cut scenes because of how uninteresting they were.  We still get to player Lara right?  Nope, she’s a totally ♥♥♥♥♥ in this game.  She’s all like “EEEWWW,” “OOWWWW" and complains about everything, which makes sense since she’s green in this game, but doesn’t  when she’s unwilling and hesitant to kill while the game is designed to encourage players to kill everything as fast as possible to farm for experience.  It’s hard to sympathize with "I don’t want to kill" when your body count is in the hundreds and rising.  Even if the above is true, it’s still an action packed game right?  Well, yeah if you hate Tomb Raider and love generic, third-person shooters… With quick time events.

content:
Posted: March 17, 2015
												This game is one of my favorite single player games on steam.  I was always a big fan of the uncharted games, but since I am now almost exclusivly a PC gamer Uncharted doesn't get played as much as it used to.  I hoped that someone would port it to PC but never found one.Enter Tomb Raider, it's enough like uncharted to satisfy my cravings, but different enough to feel like its own game.  The level design is difficult with out being impossible.  The puzzles are puzzling without being to frustrating.  The combat is fluid, and fast pased, and the stroy is amazing.  Over all I give this game a 10/10 great game to play

content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												I had a lot of danged fun with this game, but as one of my most anticipated games of the past few years, it barely warrants the 8 I'm giving up.I don't mind cinematic storytelling. I don't mind being held by the hand as buildings blow up around me and my blood is pumping through half-scripted action & both subtle / obnoxious QTEs. I have room to love the rush of immersive & 'stupid' action scenes & to be a pretentious ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ making appreciative references to Pynchon or Godard, blindly disproving his irrelevance. Tomb Raider gets the style it's going for so good, it pulls off the wannabe Uncharted action effortlessly, the island setting is designed-out-the♥♥♥♥♥fun to explore & fire arrows into the one deer you have to hunt and then the millions of men that follow it.Where the action immerses, unfortunately, the story kicks you out, cold, in the hammiest of hammy ways. Uncharted can brilliantly sit side by side with Indiana Jones after a weekend Whedon marathon, TR can't catch the b-movie feel for beans; a bad story that deserves more angry expletives than I've giving it, that smashes you, the player, over the head with condescending plot progression shown in cutscenes and then told to you multiple times in talking, overly-dramatic journal pages. Characters X&Y share a secret relationship, first shown in an early cutscene, then repeatedly the relationship's explained through the rest of the game in collectathon audio journals, making sure you, the player, know why Character X acts the way they do, despite remaining an undeveloped caricature alongside the rest of the undeveloped caricatures failing to serve any purpose to the story. Character Z&Mu let it known they're up to no good outta the gate, then again & again in every following cutscene, & yet here we are, getting paper journals recorded by them talking to themselves about how wonderfully sinister & malicious & 2-dimensional they are.Rest of the game rocks.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 18, 2015
												Tomb Raider reboot 2013--easy 9/10.The overall gameplay is really good, easy to catch on to and get the hang of. Environments are really well done and fun to explore; story is engaging and intriguing. I don't have 100% completion yet, only have 1 play thru done, and will definitely be doing more play thru's in the future.  I was reluctant to get this game initially, remembering how clunky and horrid the controls for the original tomb raider was back on the PS1 (left a bad taste in my mouth all these years over it); however, this reboot was definitely a great purchase choice.  The controls are well done and largely intuitive (I play with the Xbox controller), initially the sensitivity is set REALLY high and needs turned WAY down, but getting past that it seems to run really smooth for the most part.  Exploring environments is fun, and the puzzles, while some are a bit of a doozy to figure out, are also quite fun and offer a sense of acccomplishment when figuring them out.The story for the game is really well written, the characters are engaging and intriguing, and I personally found it very difficult to put the controller down every time I picked it up, resulting in 4+ hour play sessions.  Theres alot of slower play areas that give you time to get acquainted with the controls and movement and ability to get around; but once sh** starts to hit the fan, it hits fast and hard and goes EVERYWHERE, you have to be on your toes, paying attention to everything and have a solid grasp of where you need to go next, otherwise your probably going to die.  Fortunately the game makes EXTENSIVE use of checkpoints and an unfortunate misstep or death isn't an hours long effort retrudging and retracing to get back to where you were, but rather, you typically go back a few steps before where you died, and when everything goes to hell, theres always a checkpoint right before that happens, just in case.The negative points in this game are rather few, but enough to warrant it not being a 10/10 in my opinion, and chief among those is the cutscene "button games" where you have to hit X the Y then wiggle LS back and forth....the timing on them is....precise....to say the least, you can't do it too fast, or too slow, and you can't hit the buttons too soon, or too early, and it can be VERY frustrating.  The controls while largely well done IMO, do have some jerky moments, and aiming to shoot that enemy in front of you is a right jolly pain in the a**; they could have done well to put a bit of an auto-aim or snap function into the game able to be toggled on/off.  The gameplay, is fun, the learning curve is steep, and in combat you will die alot and fast if you don't use your cover and tactics.TL;DR~great game, love the story, gameplay is great, great characters, beautiful environments; steep learning curve, combat requires tact. and the button games on cutscenes are terribad and frustrating.  Would buy again and reccommend to anyone who enjoys exploration and fast paced combat with a well-written story.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 25, 2014
												If you are craving some action with a small amount of survivalism and stealth mixed in with a well-written story, Tomb Raider is the game for you. This series reboot breathes new life into the Tomb Raider series with an origins story of Lara Croft that features enhanced controls, a massive graphics overhaul that looks very impressive, and a new story featuring a Lara that you have never seen before. Trapped on a misterious island, Lara must adapt to her deadly surroundings, or die, shaping and changing her into the Lara you are more familiar with from times past, but it certainly is different for a while. The third person combat is a lot of fun, and picking off enemies with arrows to the face is a satisfying experience that doesn't get old. While the game features only four core weapons, the bow, the pistol, the rifle, and shotgun, they each are highly upgradeable with weapon mods and a system that is similar to leveling up, that it seems that every so often you find yourself with an entirely new loadout, which helps to keep things fresh. While the game includes some puzzle and parkour elements as well, the puzzles are few and far between, and once you have a lot of tools to aid you in surviving, the puzzles really lower in difficulty, and I can solve most of them in a few minutes without breaking a sweat, and I am not a puzzle game fanatic. The parkour, on the other hand, is well made and similar to the Uncharted series for the PS3 if you have ever played that. In fact, much of this game is reminiscent to the Uncharted series, which isn't a bad thing at all.The new updated graphics on Tomb Raider are stunning on the higher settings, and it really aids in making the island feel like a real place. The lighting and shadow effects really shine in some of the darker forests, which there are quite a lot of, and a lot of the smaller details like fire and water look absolutely amazing. There is so much attention to detail, they even have a separate physics option dedicated entirely to Lara's hair and nothing else!While the game is a lot of fun and I would highly recommend picking it up for some good fun, it isn't without its flaws. After a while, if you don't force yourself to mix up combat, it becomes incredibly repetitive. In fact, I found myself chasing achievements of getting kills with different weapons because I found myself relying on the powerful bow too much, which kept the combat a little stagnant for my tastes. However, equipping a long range mod for my shotgun as well as a flaming ammo mod and some combat dodge skills and rushing in on far away enemies shook things up, and made the game experience still fun. There are also a lot of hidden collectibles in the game, which some people may enjoy, but I didn't feel any need to spend extra time in an area to find all 15 GPS caches. However, if you are a collectible hunter, if you accidentally miss one, the campfire system lets you fast travel to a previous are, which I have never used, but some may find helpful.To sum up my points: The new Tomb Raider game is loads of fun, with smart combat, an intriguing and self-realized story, beautiful graphics, and systems that not many games include anymore, but serve to add more fun to the game. My final verdict lands this game with an 8.75 out of 10, a great game to have.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2015
												This game is 100% awesome and everyone who is even the most casual action-adventure fan should get it immediately.I am not an action game fan and find myself dying all the time in games that feature heavy action, but I absolutely loved Tomb Raider. I have actually never played any of the original Tomb Raider games, but I did play Guardians of the Light, a kind of spin-off of the Tomb Raider series. This game is awesome, a blast, and was a fun ride from beginning to end.For an action game, the controls are excellent. The level up system and the upgrade system are fun and I found myself enjoying the entire experience. Lara Croft begins this game weak and unable to cope and gradually rises up to become a great action heroine. You feel entirely in control of this character and you are able to really feel connected to her as she grows and gains abilities.If you like action movies, this is the closest I've felt to being in one. I have never had such an exhilarating experience playing a game. I pumped my fists multiple times as I advanced past intense action sequences. I give this game an 8/10 - Lots of fun, great controls, and just a blst to play.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												Holy [insert string of expletives here].Excluding seeing the two Angelina Jolie Tomb Raider films, I, to my memory (faulty as that may be) have never played a Tomb Raider game, so this new ground for me. It was my first foray into the games and first genuine foray into the collective series. Going in, I wasn't honestly sure what to expect. But what I wound up with certainly wasn't what I was expecting. But it was also so much more. I remember, before I played, seeing the trailer and all I could think to myself was "this is a game I need to own; to play." The game is brutal and engaging. It's interactive and challenging. It's terrifying and exciting. It's demanding and rewarding. And so, so much more. I went into the game not sure what to expect, but in all honesty, the game blew my absolute f***ing mind. Within the first 60 seconds I was absolutely hooked. I didn't want to eat, sleep, or bathe. I just wanted to experience everything the game had to offer. The game could not disappoint me if it tried. In fact, it, very rapidly, became one of my all time favorites.I would and will always recommend this game. 9.5/10.

Posted: July 24, 2014
												A beautiful and much-needed reboot to the Tomb Raider series.  The voice acting and motion capture by Camilla Luddington breathes new life into Laura Croft.  Plenty of side missions/quests (many of them quite tricky) add to an already immersive storyline that gives insight into the "birth" of Laura from a (some might say "soft") scientist into a battle-hardened treasure hunter.  As you complete the side missions and find relics, pay attention - you might even get a history lesson!My only real complaint is there aren't as many tombs to explore as one would expect and they're all short with fairly simple puzzles.  I understand why so much focus was placed on the main story as opposed to hunting through ancient ruins in search of fantastic treasure, but I'm not sure I entirely agree with it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 4, 2016
												This game will satisfy you.As a scion of generations of nerds and explorers, I felt that I should take up the mantle and play the Tomb Raider reboot. I was blown away. The team behind this game has managed to craft difficult scenes and gameplay that will have your adrenaline pumping and make you feel like an absolute badass, but are also very accessible to non-twitch-gamers. The atmosphere, story, and music were all on point. Tomb Raider does the inimitable Lara Croft, one of the queens of gaming badassery, great justice. Exploration is the heart and soul of this game, and you will not be left wanting. There's a lot of material, and the areas are well-crafted and masterfully give the illusion of magnificent size and space without walking for hours from one side of the map to the other.Combat is fun; although the game does seem to want you to hunker down and pick off enemies, melee combat is definitely an option. Not sure if it just makes you feel really quick, or the game AI doesn't adapt well to player bum-rushes.Although I felt compelled to sniff out all the details and finish with a 100% completion rate, I never found myself pulling out my hair, going over the same areas again and again. Completion, even achievement hunting, is satisfying and rewarding. The fast-travel mechanic aids greatly.Lastly, Lara as a character is done well and makes you root for her all the way through. Thank the gods this team avoided the pitfall Samus Aran, another badass, fell into with Other M. She's a bamf, and is surrounded by a colorful cast - my favorites were Grim and Jonah. I cannot wait to play the next title in this series. I just know it'll knock it out of the park just like this one did.Why are you still reading this? Get it and play!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												I've only played for about 3 hours so far, so this is more of a first impression than a review. In the short time I've had with this game, it's been one of the best interactive experiences I've had. So far, my only actual complaint is about some of the quick-time events. In all honesty, I actually don't mind 95% of the QTEs, and I usually hate them. There are some where you have to hit E on a timer, and others where you have to hit F. There isn't much rhyme or reason to which one will come up, so there will be plenty of times where you'll hit the wrong one and instantly fail. Otherwise, most of the QTEs actually make some level of sense, so I can stomach them.Aside from the button mashing, everything else about this game has been amazing. I'm not in deep enough yet to really know how the story is going to pan out, but the atmosphere and immersion are unbeatable. Unfortunately I haven't played the past Tomb Raider games, but this one just feels so real. Things have only gotten better the more I've played, so I can definitely recommend this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 10, 2013
												8/10.The singleplayer campaign is very linear but helps to keep the game focused. All of the quests to "Collect 10 of these items" really didn't add much to the experience and just seemed to be included purely to increase the time it takes to complete the game.Actually raiding tombs throughout each level was fairly boring as each design can be completed in all of 20 seconds if you have half a brain, and the same clip that shows Lara opening the chest at the end (but never actually lets you see the item she pockets) was fairly irritating after the first few tombs.I agree with other reviews which state they 'feel' for Lara as she develops on the island. Some of the death sequences are also pretty grim and well-made, and help to increase the feeling that she is a survivor after you complete the game.Multiplayer has been slated by various reviews but I actually find it quite fun and believe that it goes part of the way towards attoning for the extremely linear singleplayer. The level design is extremely poor but can be rectified by patches or DLC I guess. Weapons feel satisfying and traps are quite fun to use against your enemies (or to kill yourself as I happen to find on occasion).There are some bugs in the game but thankfully none of these are gamebreaking. Overall the game is worth buying and a great installment / reboot of the Tomb Raider franchise.

content:
Posted: March 11, 2015
 A famous explorer once said, that the extraordinary is in what we do, not who we are. I'd finally set out to make my mark; to find adventure. But instead adventure found me. In our darkest moments, when life flashes before us, we find something; Something that keeps us going.Gameplay+ Fun combat and traversal+ Variety of weapons and enemies+ Easy to learn controls+ Nice amount of tools for puzzles and traversal+ Upgrade system+ QT Events- Can get repetitive at times- QT Events...The gameplay in Tomb Raider can best be described as an Action Adventure Survival game. The combat is fun and you have a variety of weapons to use, with a variety of enemies to kill. Combat is improved quite a bit from the old Tomb Raiders where it was just mash left click and with an auto lock, however it can feel repetitive at times but they change it up by adding environmental options, stealth kills, and different tools at your disposal. The upgrade system they have is easy to learn, but still makes you feel like you're actually upgrading something and making your weapons, tools, or Lara herself better. Traversal is very fun, and the amount of tools they give you to get from point A to point B is quite entertaining and refreshing. There are quick time events (Press E quickly so you don't fall!) which were in the original Tomb Raider, however they seemed to have too much of them at times.I am disappointed she doesn't get dual pistols, but at the same time, relieved.Graphics+ Beautiful graphics+ Amazing looking characters+ Environment is polished, varied, and looks spectacular at every turn+ Architecture has variety and beautyThe amount of time and effort spent on each individual character, environment, cavern wall, temple, everything... is incredible. The amount of detail and polishing put into every location and enemy you face is amazing, and each has its own beauty and with plenty of variety to keep you happy.Story/Cutscenes+ Interesting and engaging story+ Character development+ Connection to the characters and story+ Journal Entries give Yamati the feeling of a real, living island with its own history+ Dark, gritty survivor storyThe story that Tomb Raider tells is not only interesting and engaging but makes you feel connections to not only the crew of the Endurance but to the island itself. With amazing character development for all the characters, you feel like the island is actually doing something, it is having an effect on everyone. And with the added bonus of collectible journal entries scattered around the island, you can get a glimpse into someone else's life and what it was like to be on the island, and often times die on the island as well. It gives the island the feeling of history, and makes it feel like a real place that has been around for centuries.Puzzles/Exploration+ Plenty of artifacts to find+ Journal Entries+ Amazing Tombs+ Fun, challenging puzzles+ Side tasks (Shoot blank amount of these, collect this many of these, ect)- Need more tombs!- Frustrating at times when you can't find a certain side task, simply because its hard to see- Glitches occasionally stop progress (Main problems I hear are about the DLC tomb)The puzzles and tombs of Tomb Raider are amazing, fun, and creative. Including puzzles with just the environment so you can continue on your way, or taking you off the path and bringing you to a tomb, taunting you with a chest of goodies at the end. There is plenty of exploration and things to find, however you are limited to a pretty nicely sized zone, and is sometimes a little too linear and not as "exploration" as I would personally like. Artifacts you find has Lara give you additional info about the origin or use of an item, which to a history junkie like me is quite interesting. The island is also littered with journal entries to find telling you about previous inhabitants of the island and their life. There are also side tasks in each area, such as collect 10 mushrooms or shoot 5 lanterns, and while it is nice and gives you something else to find it can be quite frustrating when you have looked everywhere and simply missed it the last one. There also was a disappointing amount of tombs in Tomb Raider, but each one was still fun, entertaining, and gives a sense of accomplishment for each puzzle you finish. Glitches are occasionally a problem with tombs and can set you back to the beginning, which can be frustrating but not game breaking. Tomb Raider has fun and amazingly entertaining puzzles, but lacking in actual tombs and a decent amount like we loved in the older games.Multiplayer+ Personally enjoyed multiplayer- Balancing issues- Basically deadIf you liked Uncharted's or The Last of Us multiplayer, you will enjoy Tomb Raider multiplayer. They are essentially the same thing, with different weapons and characters (but no crafting system like The Last of Us). Use the same weapons and characters you loved in the single player campaign in multiplayer as well. The only downfall is the multiplayer is all but dead. If you plan on buying this for the multiplayer only, do NOT get it.Quick ReviewI cannot recommend this game enough! If you are a fan of the old Tomb Raiders, Uncharted, Indiana Jones, or adventure games in general, you will LOVE this game. I have played this game 100% completion at least four times (once PC, twice PS3, and once PS4) and still love playing it.With entertaining gameplay, amazing puzzles, beautiful graphics, and an engaging story, this game has everything you could ask for from a reboot of one of the most beloved game franchises in the world.This is the dark, gritty, survivor story that Tomb Raider needed and deserved!A survivor is born....

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
												This is one hell of a reboot.Lara Croft wasn't always the gung-ho badass with designed-by-an-artist-who-really-needed-a-girlfriend abnormally large breasts we've known her to be. This game explores the defining moment where she turned from naive archaeology graduate without so much as a girl scout badge to her name, into a hardened survivor and fearless explorer.Gameplay wise the game is quite enjoyable. None of the puzzles are particularly taxing, the platforming is enjoyable if a little simple, and the combat is satisfying, with all the main firearms covered. The weapon upgrades are handled well, giving a wide range of options. The bow in particular remains relevant in a world of shotguns and assault rifles by being the best silent weapon by far, and becoming a valuable tool; rope arrows can move distant levers, pull down rooftops on bands of enemies or provide a way of crossing gaping chasms. Taping a lighter on allows you to set fire to arrows, burning through wooden obstacles or sowing panic in enemy ranks.The story and writing is where the game shines. Early on, Lara is frightened, vulnerable and lacking in experience, and the dialogue, body language and objectives all reflect this. The first time she is forced to kill an animal to avoid starving is a big deal, the first time she has to kill another human even more so (there's a bit of a discrepancy between her first kill being so harrowing and the hundred or so other enemies she guns down in the course of the game, but combat would've been awfully dull without them, to be fair). Everything about the hardships she faces and eventually overcomes is handled tastefully and cleverly, and avoids the majority of twee clichés. The story is handled excellently. Shipwrecked on a mysterious island, anyone who tries to leave is subjected to storms that blow them back to shore or drown them outright. Something weird is at the heart of the island, and a brutal cult of shipwrecked survivors has grown up around it. The supernatural is revealed at just the right time and in just the right amount. It's never used to explain away plot holes or provide a magical maguffin, but it's an important part of the story, and it does that best from the background, emerging every now and then to challenge Lara's perception of the world and force her to adapt her opinions on a variety of things.Get Tomb Raider. It's a very entertaining exploration/combat game fleshed out with a superbly-crafted story and cast of characters. It shows us all WHY Lara Croft is such a badass, and the explanation is well worth the effort.

content:
Posted: July 13, 2014
												This game is really fun and addicting. I logged 25 hours in 3 days with no shame and I'm not a big gamer. I normally play one or two games of league a day and some hearthstone too.What makes this game interesting is how easy it is to get emersed into the story.  The action sequence and the camera angles make the story very attractive and powerful in both the cinematics and gameplay.  The game is also relatively linear in most of the cases where it is easy to travel to next point of interest without too much challenge in exploring to help players progress.  The inclusion of tombs as secret puzzles keeps in-line with the theme of tomb raider along the action packed storyline.  I also really like the battle sequences that reminds me of God of war.  Also, the fact that Lara regenerates when not taking damage makes it easier to play because you don't need to worry about having to heal up in mid fight,My only complain is the game starts off very realistic but gets a bit crazy dealing with supernaturals.  It also bugs me that some of those epic jumps across cliffs are kind of crazy that rarely will be done in realistic setting.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
												If you are looking for the tombs in Tomb Raider, than this game is not for you. You can find them in game, but mostly as an optional quick puzzles than actual long trips older games had. Howewer when comes to exploration and story, this game shows where its strength lies. And in this aspect, it is best damn Tomb Raider to date. You have many areas to explore, optional items to find, some RPG elements as well and skills to learn. You will also meet many great characters during the game, all fully voiced of course and with great acting and writing behind them, no matter if it is a major character important to the plot or a minor sidekick. For its time, the game had very good visuals too and even today it can hold its own. Must buy for every Tomb Raider fan. Do not dwell on multiplayer too much though, it does not really work well; it was clearly added late to the game and only few people are playing it.Score: 9/10  + Story  + Exploration  + Graphics  + Skill development  + Great characters  - Lack of classic tombs  - Multiplayer is clearly late and unnecessary addition

content:
Posted: April 13, 2015
												This is a fun game. Graphics are really good. Gripping story with plenty of twists. Combat is very good. I like this game. There are a few things to mention though.Charachter models, you can tell they put much more time into "Lara" than any other charachter. She looks really good, whilst the rest of them look quite generic. This might have been the intention of the game, seen as we play with Lara.The map, lots of areas look the same although I will say that they still had their own unique vibe.Tombs, some of them were easy, some were very very hard so they had a nice balance.FPS, well, it was irratic to say the least. I have quite a good PC and whilst mostly I maintained 60 FPS (with Vsync) the game did stutter from time to time which IMO took away from the experience. Did not seem like it was optimised too well. It was good for the most part.In closing, I do like this game. FInding the collectables was a challenge. I did play this on console so knew what I was doing for the most part on my PC play through. If you have not played this game yet, I would say it is worth. It has a lot going for it.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
												Tomb RaiderWhat a wonderful game, I thoroughly enjoyed my time playing as Lara Croft. The game has plenty of action parts, and plenty of exploring to be had. I have finally finished the game, which I never thought I could do, but now I want more. So now I will go back over the island to my last save camps and teleport back and forth, and try and seek out and find as many unfound items, relics and diarys that I have missed and perhaps complete some small task challenges as well.If your a fan of Tomb Raider and love Lara Croft, then this game is a must play, so if you have the game and have not gotten around to playing it yet, then you really should add this game to your "to play list". The game did not disapoint, and my laptop handled it really well, but I had to have all settings set to low and I was very impressed with the quality my laptop presented me. It does make my laptop run at higher core temperature's as I have noticed, but never crashed or coursed me any mager issues. I have not tried out the Multiplayer side to this game, and not sure if its still viable to do so. I would like to give it a try at some point in time, just to see what its like and if its as good as single player.Yeah I know my review is not so great, but I just wanted to share that I finally finished this game, but not 100% completion, as I still have multiplayer acheviements to be had (I may not get any of them anyway) as multiplayer may be dead.Anyway the game was fun and I thoroughly enjoyed it, even if I did die plenty times.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 15, 2015
												Great reboot of an awesome Tomb Raider franchise. This is pretty much a modern world, fantasy, action RPG, where young Lara is just a young woman who is trying to find herself as a Tomb Raider. I advise to not play this under the age limitations as it has some elements of horror and bloody nature apart from cold blood murders and other gruesome acts of violence. Game has a bit of open world element to it, though it's mostly instanced areas with the ability to revisit. A lot of weapon customization and upgrade, a lot of platforming and jumping, puzzles and secrets. Game has great fictional story, with great character design, incredible voice acting and animation (very emotional for Lara).

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 13, 2013
												Lara Croft seems like a human being, which is a rare thing in videogames. The tension and suspense, combined with empathy for Lara, makes me actually interested in what happens next, like reading a good book. Theres little to no awkward mechanics to ruin the atmosphere, either. The movement is nearly perfect, the RPG elements are nicely implemented, but the quicktime events are annoying and it would be better to just integrate the button mashing into other mechanics, but they don;t come up very often, so it's not really a problem. Overall, this is a fun and engaging game, with actual emotion tied to it, rather than the usual "serious faic marine is a pretty cool guy eh shoots stuff and doesnt afraid of anything". You should buy it, or at least try it at a friends house or something.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2014
												Nice game. Revitalizes the entire franchises. Have been playing tomb raider since playstation days and none could get me into it like this game. The enemies are fun to fight against using cover and various tactics to flush you out of cover and finish you off. The weapons, while only 4 have plenty of upgrades that make it each version feeling fresh. The island location that the game takes place in is nice, large and open to exploration and doesnt feel like it traps you in a square in terms of where you can go. if you can go somewhere often times  its because you lack the appropriate tools to access those areas. While playing single player there are some small tasks that i call 'side quests' that can be used to collect xp and loot to level up lara's skills and weapons and for the most times can be tackled anytime you are in the area for the quest. all in all this is a good game thats a long time coming. if you like games like uncharted series you are definately gonna love this game. 8.8/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 18, 2015
												Tomb Raider reboot 2013--easy 9/10.The overall gameplay is really good, easy to catch on to and get the hang of. Environments are really well done and fun to explore; story is engaging and intriguing. I don't have 100% completion yet, only have 1 play thru done, and will definitely be doing more play thru's in the future.  I was reluctant to get this game initially, remembering how clunky and horrid the controls for the original tomb raider was back on the PS1 (left a bad taste in my mouth all these years over it); however, this reboot was definitely a great purchase choice.  The controls are well done and largely intuitive (I play with the Xbox controller), initially the sensitivity is set REALLY high and needs turned WAY down, but getting past that it seems to run really smooth for the most part.  Exploring environments is fun, and the puzzles, while some are a bit of a doozy to figure out, are also quite fun and offer a sense of acccomplishment when figuring them out.The story for the game is really well written, the characters are engaging and intriguing, and I personally found it very difficult to put the controller down every time I picked it up, resulting in 4+ hour play sessions.  Theres alot of slower play areas that give you time to get acquainted with the controls and movement and ability to get around; but once sh** starts to hit the fan, it hits fast and hard and goes EVERYWHERE, you have to be on your toes, paying attention to everything and have a solid grasp of where you need to go next, otherwise your probably going to die.  Fortunately the game makes EXTENSIVE use of checkpoints and an unfortunate misstep or death isn't an hours long effort retrudging and retracing to get back to where you were, but rather, you typically go back a few steps before where you died, and when everything goes to hell, theres always a checkpoint right before that happens, just in case.The negative points in this game are rather few, but enough to warrant it not being a 10/10 in my opinion, and chief among those is the cutscene "button games" where you have to hit X the Y then wiggle LS back and forth....the timing on them is....precise....to say the least, you can't do it too fast, or too slow, and you can't hit the buttons too soon, or too early, and it can be VERY frustrating.  The controls while largely well done IMO, do have some jerky moments, and aiming to shoot that enemy in front of you is a right jolly pain in the a**; they could have done well to put a bit of an auto-aim or snap function into the game able to be toggled on/off.  The gameplay, is fun, the learning curve is steep, and in combat you will die alot and fast if you don't use your cover and tactics.TL;DR~great game, love the story, gameplay is great, great characters, beautiful environments; steep learning curve, combat requires tact. and the button games on cutscenes are terribad and frustrating.  Would buy again and reccommend to anyone who enjoys exploration and fast paced combat with a well-written story.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2015
												This game is 100% awesome and everyone who is even the most casual action-adventure fan should get it immediately.I am not an action game fan and find myself dying all the time in games that feature heavy action, but I absolutely loved Tomb Raider. I have actually never played any of the original Tomb Raider games, but I did play Guardians of the Light, a kind of spin-off of the Tomb Raider series. This game is awesome, a blast, and was a fun ride from beginning to end.For an action game, the controls are excellent. The level up system and the upgrade system are fun and I found myself enjoying the entire experience. Lara Croft begins this game weak and unable to cope and gradually rises up to become a great action heroine. You feel entirely in control of this character and you are able to really feel connected to her as she grows and gains abilities.If you like action movies, this is the closest I've felt to being in one. I have never had such an exhilarating experience playing a game. I pumped my fists multiple times as I advanced past intense action sequences. I give this game an 8/10 - Lots of fun, great controls, and just a blst to play.

content:
Posted: March 25, 2013
												The new Tomb Raider is a pretty fun game, all things considered. The story is an origin story - about how Lara Croft became who she is in all the older games; you know - that badass woman with the big breasts that kicks♥♥♥♥♥♥Anyways, onto the game itself as well as the gameplay.The Game: Tomb Raider (2013) is (at least in my opinion) a pretty fun game - it's not a platformer in the same way that the older games were, it's more of a third-person shooter with some "platforming" things added. Lara's hair is pretty fancy if you enable AMD's TressFX (which luckly for me, works with Nvidia GPUs). Anyways aside from her hair - poor Lara gets the living♥♥♥♥♥♥beat out of her in this game, I'm not sure how a woman who has NEVER even fired a gun or bow can all-of-the-sudden master these types of weapons and also suddenly take all this damage and kill all these people.Maybe it's because some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s stole her bestest-friend and want to sacrifice her to some god or whatever - I mean if some people took my best friend I'd do some crazy♥♥♥♥♥♥too to save her, but that's besides the point. I'm not gonna jump over a cliff with a 100 foot drop at the end and hope my ice axe can stick into a rock wall, then climb 30 feet to save her, I'm not even sure I could do that considering my health, and the fact I'm using an ICE AXE! Anyways this isn't about me - this is about Lara f*cking Croft - so I guess she's just a very quick learner and able to kick some serious♥♥♥♥♥♥very quickly too... Maybe I could learn all these things too? Although I already know how to fire a gun and shoot a bow, so that would help me, but I'm not Lara and this isn't my game.The game does have an OK story - and SPOILER ends in a happy way. END OF SPOILER Anyways it does all seem a bit extreme as an origin story. Now if the game was about Lara just doing what she always does it'd make a hell-of-a-lot more sense, but whatever that was the developer's choice to make.Gameplay: The gameplay mechanics are pretty straightforward - there are some quicktime events, which I hate, but hey, it was a console game to begin with, so we PC gamers will just have to deal with it - just try not to get Lara's head impaled on a random spike when sliding down water-rapids, kay? Lawl. Aiming is easy, as is taking cover. There is plenty of ammo for her guns and arrows for her bow, in addition there are puzzles to solve, similar to the ones in Half-Life 2, except they require a little bit more thinking, in some cases. I found the puzzles to be kind-of fun, but some people I know hated them - but what do they know?! This is MY review! In addition there are weapon upgrades - for instance you may start out with some kind-of WWII submachine gun but end up with an AK-47 - which isn't an SMG at all, but an assault rifle.Aside from the quicktime events, the jumps over 100 foot falls just to dig your axe into a cliff and climb 30 feet, and the puzzles - this game is your basic TPS (third-person shooter). It also has some cutscenes but I didn't find them annoying or unnecessary, but again that's just my opinion.When it comes down to it, I do love a game with a badarse strong-willed female protagonist, and these kinds-of games are becoming more common these days - either the main character is one - like in this game, or you can choose from a selection of characters and one is a female (for instance the Borderlands series). I like this game and I also think it looks pretty good, especially with that amazing hair! xDMultiplayer: The multiplayer is rubbish - it's a tacky addon similar to the multiplayer in Bioshock 2 - I recommend avoiding it unless you actually happen to like it... I found it's full of hackers and people ranked way higher than you so no fun there. That'll be the end of this...Conclusion: Overall I find this game pretty fun, and as I said before, having a strong female protagonist adds to the appeal (at least to me). The quicktimes events lower the score a little, however I had no problem watching the cutscenes. I found the climbing mechanics and other stuff like the rope-arrows pretty easy to master and nothing was really that hard, not even the "bosses". I do think the multiplayer is garbage and I'd recommend avoiding it if I were you - just play the singleplayer, that is fun enough.Score: 4/5 - Great Game with an Amazing Protagonist[Edits made to fix grammatical errors.]
